topic.title: Interface Effector
topic.body:
public interface Effector Effector is the interface for Casbin effectors.
Method Summary
Modifier and Type Method and Description
boolean
mergeEffects(String expr, Effect[] effects, float[] results)- mergeEffects merges all matching results collected by the enforcer into a single decision.
Method Detail
mergeEffects
public boolean mergeEffects(String expr, Effect[] effects, float[] results)
mergeEffects merges all matching results collected by the enforcer into a single decision.
Parameters:
expr- the expression of [policy_effect].
effects- the effects of all matched rules.
results- the matcher results of all matched rules.
Returns:
the final effect.

ul.li: CoreEnforcerCoreEnforcer defines the core functionality of an enforcer.

body.p: CoreEnforcer defines the core functionality of an enforcer.

row.entry: buildRoleLinks()- buildRoleLinks manually rebuild the role inheritance relations.
enableAutoBuildRoleLinks(boolean autoBuildRoleLinks)- enableAutoBuildRoleLinks controls whether to save a policy rule automatically to the adapter when it is added or removed.
enableAutoSave(boolean autoSave)- enableAutoSave controls whether to save a policy rule automatically to the adapter when it is added or removed.
enableEnforce(boolean enable)- enableEnforce changes the enforcing state of Casbin, when Casbin is disabled, all access will be allowed by the enforce() function.
enableLog(boolean enable)- enableLog changes whether to print Casbin log to the standard output.
enforce(Object... rvals)- enforce decides whether a "subject" can access a "object" with the operation "action", input parameters are usually: (sub, obj, act).

entry.p: enforce decides whether a "subject" can access a "object" with the operation "action", input parameters are usually: (sub, obj, act).

entry.p: whether to allow the request.

entry.p: addPermissionForUser adds a permission for a user or role.
Returns false if the user or role already has the permission (aka not affected).

ul.li: permission- the permission, usually be (obj, act). It is actually the rule without the subject.

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getImplicitPermissionsForUser(String user)
entry.p: getImplicitPermissionsForUser gets implicit permissions for a user or role.
Compared to getPermissionsForUser(), this function retrieves permissions for inherited roles. For example: p, admin, data1, read p, alice, data2, read g, alice, admin
getPermissionsForUser("alice") can only get: [["alice", "data2", "read"]]. But getImplicitPermissionsForUser("alice") will get: [["admin", "data1", "read"], ["alice", "data2", "read"]].
implicit permissions for a user or role.

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getImplicitPermissionsForUserInDomain(String user, String domain)
entry.p: getImplicitPermissionsForUserInDomain gets implicit permissions for a user or role in domain.
implicit permissions for a user or role in domain.

entry.codeblock: public List< String > getImplicitRolesForUser(String name, String... domain)
entry.p: getImplicitRolesForUser gets implicit roles that a user has.
Compared to getRolesForUser(), this function retrieves indirect roles besides direct roles. For example: g, alice, role:admin g, role:admin, role:user
getRolesForUser("alice") can only get: ["role:admin"]. But getImplicitRolesForUser("alice") will get: ["role:admin", "role:user"].
implicit roles that a user has.

the permissions, a permission is usually like (obj, act). It is actually the rule without the subject.

getRolesForUser gets the roles that a user has.
the roles that the user has.

entry.codeblock: public void addFunction(String name, AviatorFunction function)
entry.p: addFunction adds a customized function.

ul.li: name- the name of the new function.

entry.p: addGroupingPolicy adds a role inheritance rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: params- the "g" policy rule, ptype "g" is implicitly used.

entry.p: succeeds or not.
addGroupingPolicy adds a role inheritance rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: params- the "g" policy rule, ptype "g" is implicitly used.

entry.p: succeeds or not.
addNamedGroupingPolicy adds a named role inheritance rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "g", "g2", "g3", ..

entry.p: succeeds or not.

entry.codeblock: public boolean addNamedGroupingPolicy(String ptype, String... params)
entry.p: addNamedGroupingPolicy adds a named role inheritance rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "g", "g2", "g3", ..

entry.p: succeeds or not.
AddNamedPolicy adds an authorization rule to the current named policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..

entry.p: succeeds or not.

entry.codeblock: public boolean addNamedPolicy(String ptype, String... params)
entry.p: AddNamedPolicy adds an authorization rule to the current named policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..

entry.p: succeeds or not.
addPolicy adds an authorization rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: params- the "p" policy rule, ptype "p" is implicitly used.

entry.p: succeeds or not.
addPolicy adds an authorization rule to the current policy.
If the rule already exists, the function returns false and the rule will not be added. Otherwise the function returns true by adding the new rule.

ul.li: params- the "p" policy rule, ptype "p" is implicitly used.

entry.p: succeeds or not.
getAllActions gets the list of actions that show up in the current policy.
all the actions in "p" policy rules. It actually collects the 2-index elements of "p" policy rules. So make sure your action is the 2-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
GetAllNamedActions gets the list of actions that show up in the current named policy.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..

entry.p: all the actions in policy rules of the ptype type. It actually collects the 2-index elements of the policy rules. So make sure your action is the 2-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
getAllNamedObjects gets the list of objects that show up in the current named policy.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..

entry.p: all the objects in policy rules of the ptype type. It actually collects the 1-index elements of the policy rules. So make sure your object is the 1-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
getAllNamedRoles gets the list of roles that show up in the current named policy.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "g", "g2", "g3", ..

entry.p: all the subjects in policy rules of the ptype type. It actually collects the 0-index elements of the policy rules. So make sure your subject is the 0-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
GetAllNamedSubjects gets the list of subjects that show up in the currentnamed policy.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..

entry.p: all the subjects in policy rules of the ptype type. It actually collects the 0-index elements of the policy rules. So make sure your subject is the 0-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
getAllObjects gets the list of objects that show up in the current policy.
all the objects in "p" policy rules. It actually collects the 1-index elements of "p" policy rules. So make sure your object is the 1-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.
getAllRoles gets the list of roles that show up in the current policy.
all the roles in "g" policy rules. It actually collects the 1-index elements of "g" policy rules. So make sure your role is the 1-index element, like (sub, role). Duplicates are removed.
getAllSubjects gets the list of subjects that show up in the current policy.
all the subjects in "p" policy rules. It actually collects the 0-index elements of "p" policy rules. So make sure your subject is the 0-index element, like (sub, obj, act). Duplicates are removed.

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getFilteredGroupingPolicy(int fieldIndex, String... fieldValues)
entry.p: getFilteredGroupingPolicy gets all the role inheritance rules in the policy, field filters can be specified.

ul.li: fieldIndex- the policy rule's start index to be matched.
fieldValues- the field values to be matched, value "" means not to match this field.

entry.p: the filtered "g" policy rules.

entry.p: getFilteredNamedGroupingPolicy gets all the role inheritance rules in the policy, field filters can be specified.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "g", "g2", "g3", ..
fieldIndex- the policy rule's start index to be matched.
fieldValues- the field values to be matched, value "" means not to match this field.

entry.p: the filtered "g" policy rules of the specified ptype.

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getFilteredNamedPolicy(String ptype, int fieldIndex, String... fieldValues)
entry.p: getFilteredNamedPolicy gets all the authorization rules in the named policy, field filters can be specified.

ul.li: ptype- the policy type, can be "p", "p2", "p3", ..
fieldIndex- the policy rule's start index to be matched.
fieldValues- the field values to be matched, value "" means not to match this field.

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getFilteredPolicy(int fieldIndex, String... fieldValues)

entry.codeblock: public List< List< String > > getImplicitPermissionsForUser(String user)
entry.p: getImplicitPermissionsForUser gets implicit permissions for a user or role.

getImplicitPermissionsForUser in class
Enforcer
Compared to getPermissionsForUser(), this function retrieves permissions for inherited roles. For example: p, admin, data1, read p, alice, data2, read g, alice, admin
getPermissionsForUser("alice") can only get: [["alice", "data2", "read"]]. But getImplicitPermissionsForUser("alice") will get: [["admin", "data1", "read"], ["alice", "data2", "read"]].
implicit permissions for a user or role.

entry.codeblock: public List< String > getImplicitRolesForUser(String name, String... domain)
entry.p: getImplicitRolesForUser gets implicit roles that a user has.

getImplicitRolesForUser in class
Enforcer
Compared to getRolesForUser(), this function retrieves indirect roles besides direct roles. For example: g, alice, role:admin g, role:admin, role:user
getRolesForUser("alice") can only get: ["role:admin"]. But getImplicitRolesForUser("alice") will get: ["role:admin", "role:user"].
implicit roles that a user has.

WatcherWatcher is the interface for Casbin watchers.

topic.title: Interface Adapter
topic.body:
public interface Adapter Adapter is the interface for Casbin adapters.
Method Summary
Modifier and Type Method and Description
void
addPolicy(String sec, String ptype, List​<​String​>​rule)- addPolicy adds a policy rule to the storage.
void
loadPolicy(Model model)- loadPolicy loads all policy rules from the storage.
void
removeFilteredPolicy(String sec, String ptype, int fieldIndex, String... fieldValues)- removeFilteredPolicy removes policy rules that match the filter from the storage.
void
removePolicy(String sec, String ptype, List​<​String​>​rule)- removePolicy removes a policy rule from the storage.
void
savePolicy(Model model)- savePolicy saves all policy rules to the storage.
Method Detail
addPolicy
public void addPolicy(String sec, String ptype, List​<​String​>​rule)
addPolicy adds a policy rule to the storage.
This is part of the Auto-Save feature.
Parameters:
sec- the section, "p" or "g".
ptype- the policy type, "p", "p2", .. or "g", "g2", ..
rule- the rule, like (sub, obj, act).
loadPolicy
public void loadPolicy(Model model)
loadPolicy loads all policy rules from the storage.
Parameters:
model- the model.
removeFilteredPolicy
public void removeFilteredPolicy(String sec, String ptype, int fieldIndex, String... fieldValues)
removeFilteredPolicy removes policy rules that match the filter from the storage.
This is part of the Auto-Save feature.
Parameters:
sec- the section, "p" or "g".
ptype- the policy type, "p", "p2", .. or "g", "g2", ..
fieldIndex- the policy rule's start index to be matched.
fieldValues- the field values to be matched, value "" means not to match this field.
removePolicy
public void removePolicy(String sec, String ptype, List​<​String​>​rule)
removePolicy removes a policy rule from the storage.
This is part of the Auto-Save feature.
Parameters:
sec- the section, "p" or "g".
ptype- the policy type, "p", "p2", .. or "g", "g2", ..
rule- the rule, like (sub, obj, act).
savePolicy
public void savePolicy(Model model)
savePolicy saves all policy rules to the storage.
Parameters:
model- the model.

topic.title: Interface Watcher
topic.body:
public interface Watcher Watcher is the interface for Casbin watchers.
Method Summary
Modifier and Type Method and Description
void
setUpdateCallback(Runnable runnable)- SetUpdateCallback sets the callback function that the watcher will call when the policy in DB has been changed by other instances.
void
update()- Update calls the update callback of other instances to synchronize their policy.
Method Detail
setUpdateCallback
public void setUpdateCallback(Runnable runnable)
SetUpdateCallback sets the callback function that the watcher will call when the policy in DB has been changed by other instances.
A classic callback is Enforcer.loadPolicy().
Parameters:
runnable- the callback function, will be called when policy is updated.
update
public void update()
Update calls the update callback of other instances to synchronize their policy.
It is usually called after changing the policy in DB, like Enforcer.savePolicy(), Enforcer.addPolicy(), Enforcer.removePolicy(), etc.

ul.li: FileAdapterFileAdapter is the file adapter for Casbin.

body.p: FileAdapter is the file adapter for Casbin.
It can load policy from file or save policy to file.

removePolicy(String sec, String ptype, List​<​String​>​rule)- removePolicy removes a policy rule from the storage.
savePolicy(Model model)- savePolicy saves all policy rules to the storage.

ul.li: GroupRoleManagerGroupRoleManager is used for authorization if the user's group is the role who has permission, but the group information is in the default format (policy start with "g") and the role information is in named format (policy start with "g2", "g3", ...).
RoleRole represents the data structure for a role in RBAC.

row.entry: DefaultRoleManager(int maxHierarchyLevel)- DefaultRoleManager is the constructor for creating an instance of the default RoleManager implementation.
addLink(String name1, String name2, String... domain)- addLink adds the inheritance link between role: name1 and role: name2.
clear()- clear clears all stored data and resets the role manager to the initial state.
deleteLink(String name1, String name2, String... domain)- deleteLink deletes the inheritance link between role: name1 and role: name2.
getRoles(String name, String... domain)- getRoles gets the roles that a subject inherits.
getUsers(String name)- getUsers gets the users that inherits a subject.
hasLink(String name1, String name2, String... domain)- hasLink determines whether role: name1 inherits role: name2.
printRoles()- printRoles prints all the roles to log.

body.p: GroupRoleManager is used for authorization if the user's group is the role who has permission, but the group information is in the default format (policy start with "g") and the role information is in named format (policy start with "g2", "g3", ...).
e.g. p, admin, domain1, data1, read g, alice, group1 g2, group1, admin, domain1
As for the previous example, alice should have the permission to read data1, but if we use the DefaultRoleManager, it will return false. GroupRoleManageris to handle this situation.

row.entry: generateGFunction(String name, RoleManager rm)- generateGFunction is the factory method of the g(_, _) function.
ipMatch(String ip1, String ip2)- ipMatch determines whether IP address ip1 matches the pattern of IP address ip2, ip2 can be an IP address or a CIDR pattern.
keyMatch(String key1, String key2)- keyMatch determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
keyMatch2(String key1, String key2)- keyMatch2 determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
keyMatch3(String key1, String key2)- keyMatch3 determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
regexMatch(String key1, String key2)- regexMatch determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 in regular expression.

entry.codeblock: public static AviatorFunction generateGFunction(String name, RoleManager rm)
entry.p: generateGFunction is the factory method of the g(_, _) function.

ul.li: name- the name of the g(_, _) function, can be "g", "g2", ..
rm- the role manager used by the function.

entry.p: the function.

entry.codeblock: public static boolean ipMatch(String ip1, String ip2)
entry.p: ipMatch determines whether IP address ip1 matches the pattern of IP address ip2, ip2 can be an IP address or a CIDR pattern.
whether ip1 matches ip2.

entry.codeblock: public static boolean keyMatch(String key1, String key2)
entry.p: keyMatch determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
For example, "/foo/bar" matches "/foo/*"
whether key1 matches key2.

entry.codeblock: public static boolean keyMatch2(String key1, String key2)
entry.p: keyMatch2 determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
For example, "/foo/bar" matches "/foo/*", "/resource1" matches "/:resource"
whether key1 matches key2.

entry.codeblock: public static boolean keyMatch3(String key1, String key2)
entry.p: keyMatch3 determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 (similar to RESTful path), key2 can contain a *.
For example, "/foo/bar" matches "/foo/*", "/resource1" matches "/{resource}"
whether key1 matches key2.

entry.codeblock: public static boolean regexMatch(String key1, String key2)
entry.p: regexMatch determines whether key1 matches the pattern of key2 in regular expression.
whether key1 matches key2.

arrayEquals(List​<​String​>​a, List​<​String​>​b)- arrayEquals determines whether two string arrays are identical.
arrayRemoveDuplicates(List​<​String​>​s)- arrayRemoveDuplicates removes any duplicated elements in a string array.
arrayToString(List​<​String​>​s)- arrayToString gets a printable string for a string array.
escapeAssertion(String s)- escapeAssertion escapes the dots in the assertion, because the expression evaluation doesn't support such variable names.
logPrint(String v)- logPrint prints the log.
logPrintf(String format, String... v)- logPrintf prints the log with the format.
logPrintfError(String format, Object... v)- logPrintf prints the log with the format as an error.
logPrintfWarn(String format, Object... v)- logPrintf prints the log with the format as a warning.
paramsToString(String[] s)- paramsToString gets a printable string for variable number of parameters.
removeComments(String s)- removeComments removes the comments starting with # in the text.
setEquals(List​<​String​>​a, List​<​String​>​b)- setEquals determines whether two string sets are identical.

entry.p: array2DEquals determines whether two 2-dimensional string arrays are identical.
whether a equals to b.
